comment: Best protester I have ever had medium on difficult class but when taking task there are no surprises and he had many lady friends awesome teacher would easily take this class again and he j is his history better than anyone else

you really learned so much in his class and it's a very interesting class. for his quizzes and test he's very clear on what to expect but you have to study in order to pass. very direct on what to expect and expects you will read what is given. readings were hard at times.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I appreciate we could relax when learning. You know what you're gonna get into and he'll make sure you make it in class if you work hard.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He was interested in what I had to think more than just doing an assignment for a grade. That's rare. Learned a ton about the African American and African experience. He really helped making our discussions fun.

Theres so much to learn in one setting!!! That's the toughest part cause so much reading can be difficult. Still the class was enjoyable. You will learn something new and we don't have to do papers for grades since the main tasks are showing what you learned from the topics we covered. I loved being able to get creative!

ADDS1101 was a course we took online years ago. The only way you would really fail is by not trying or doing the assigned readings. Having someone ask you what you think was different than many were used to because some many others just lectured. He really loves group discussions.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: I told Professor Greaves I appreciated his love for elderly communities. You will walk away having a love for knowing what happened in our past. He was very knowledgeable of his history and so many others.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Learned Americas whole history and the class was fun. There were many group projects and it helped us think. We learned a lot about different cultures in Americas history who made a huge impact. Room smelled like vanilla most times and he always had scarves. Sad some peers lied on May 14th talking on his hair or clothes but he pushed us to grow.

Last year I learned a lot on history and our own family history. Dressed sharp, was patient, kind and went the extra mile. If you didn't pay attention in class, you didn't do well. We also had open notes on many tests! Learned on so many in US history, from Conquistadors to the Trail of Tears, Underground Railroad and American Revolution leaders.
This history teacher was one of the most caring teachers in the grade. He loved our class and tough us his deep heritage. He was a very good teacher and never lashed out towards my peers.
Bad teacher takes peoples stuff and destroys it only talks about slaves and we have learned about 3 people within ten months would not recomend
I made a false report about Professor greaves in my middle school Social studies class. That cam right before this one. Since there are no classes taught this fall and I am in middle school.

Honestly, a pretty terrible professor who doesn't know how to organize a class schedule. He doesn't upload grades until the last day of class so you won't know you were failing until then. The final and midterm were super hard to locate and weigh the most on your grade. Since he's the only AADS professor I'd just skip out on this class for another.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Do not take this Professor! His instructions on assignments are not clear.There’s also not specified due dates so I just suggest don’t wait until the last minute. No feedback whatsoever.He does not communicate/respond to emails at all. He also hasn’t put in a single grade since this semester has started and we’re over half way throug.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Does not respond to emails, posts material late, has optional information sessions but it feels mandatory. Not a textbook but he posts a lot of reading (Did not read all). Quizzes does not show your grade and he makes you take them but he says they don't count as a grade. He says discussion makes up the majority of your grade (easy).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters
